sen.j: 後桃園天皇（ごももぞのてんのう、宝暦8年7月2日（1758年8月5日） - 安永8年10月29日（1779年12月6日））は、江戸時代の第118代天皇（在位：明和7年4月28日（1770年5月23日） - 安永8年11月9日（1779年12月16日））。
sen.e: Emperor Gomomozono (August 5th, 1758 - December 6th, 1779) was the hundred eighteenth Emperor during Edo period. (his reign was May 23rd, 1770 - December 16th, 1779.)
Emperor Gomomozono (August 5th, 1758 - December 6th, 1779) was the hundred eighteenth Emperor during the Edo period. (his reign wasfrom May 23rd, 1770 to December 16th, 1779.)
Emperor Gomomozono (August 5, 1758 - December 6, 1779) was the hundred eighteenth Emperor during the Edo period. (his reign was from May 23, 1770 to December 16, 1779.)
sen.cmt: 日付表記スペース挿入

sen.j: 諱は英仁（ひでひと）。
sen.e: His posthumous name was Hidehito.
His posthumous name was Hidehito.
His posthumous name was Hidehito.

sen.j: なお、天皇急逝のため、後継の準備の為に実際よりも後の日付で発表されたため、在位日が死亡後も続いている（宮内庁所蔵「後桃園院御凶事前後記」）。
sen.e: Since the Emperor died suddenly, it was accounted later than the actual date he died as there was a preparation to succeed to the Imperial throne, the period of his era continued after he died. (The collection of the Imperial Household Agency, 'The record of the death of Gomomozonoin'.)
sen.cmt: 後桃園院御凶事前後記→Ｔhe record of the death of Gomomozono-in[定訳不明]
sen.e: Since the Emperor died suddenly, it was counted later than the actual date that he died while preparing to succeed to the Imperial throne, the period of his era continued after he died. (The collections of the Imperial Household Agency, 'The record of the death of Gomomozonoin'.)

Since the Emperor died suddenly, it was counted later than the actual date that he died while preparing to succeed to the Imperial throne, the period of his era continued after he died (The collections of the Imperial Household Agency, 'The record of the death of Gomomozonoin').

sen.j: 系譜
sen.e: Genealogy
Genealogy
Genealogy

sen.j: 桃園天皇の第一皇子。
sen.e: He was the first Prince of Emperor Momozono.
He was the first Prince of Emperor Momozono.
He was the first Prince of Emperor Momozono.

sen.j: 母は関白太政大臣一条兼香（かねか）の娘で桃園女御の恭礼門院・藤原富子。
sen.e: His mother was the chancellor (chief advisor to the emperor) and the Grand Minister, Kaneka ICHIJO's daughter and a high-ranking lady in the court; an empress of Momozono, Kyoraimon in FUJIWARA no Tomiko.

His mother was the chancellor (chief advisor to the emperor) and the Grand Minister, Kaneka ICHIJO's daughter and a high-ranking lady in the court; an empress of Momozono, Kyoraimon in FUJIWARA no Tomiko.

His mother was the chancellor (chief advisor to the emperor) and the Grand Minister, Kaneka ICHIJO's daughter and a high-ranking lady in the court; an empress of Momozono, Kyoraimon in FUJIWARA no Tomiko.

sen.j: 同母弟に伏見宮貞行親王がいる。
sen.e: Fushimi no Miya Prince Sadamochi was his half younger brother.
Fushimi no Miya Prince Sadamochi was his half younger brother.
Imperial Prince Fushimi no Miya Sadamochi was his half younger brother.

sen.j: 略歴
sen.e: Biography
Biography
Brief Personal History
sen.cmt: 他ファイルに合わせる

sen.j: 明和5年2月19日（1768年4月6日）に立太子し、明和7年（1770年）伯母後桜町天皇の譲位を受けて即位。
sen.e: He became Crown Prince on April 6th, 1768 and succeeded to the throne after his aunt, Emperor Gosakuramachi passed the throne to him.
He became Crown Prince on April 6th, 1768 and succeeded to the throne after his aunt, Empress Gosakuramachi, passed the throne to him.
He became Crown Prince on April 6, 1768 and succeeded to the throne after his aunt, Empress Gosakuramachi, passed the throne to him.

sen.j: 天皇は病気がちであり、安永8年（1779年）に在位のまま22歳で崩御。
sen.e: The Emperor was not well and he died when he was twenty two years old while he was in power in 1779.
The Emperor was not well and he died when he was twenty two years old while he was in power in 1779.
The Emperor was not well and he died when he was twenty two years old while he was in power in 1779.

sen.j: 子が欣子内親王のみであったので、急遽、閑院宮家より養子を迎え（閑院宮師仁親王、即位後は兼仁に改名）、光格天皇として即位させた。
sen.e: Since his only child was Princess Yoshiko, the Imperial family adopted a child from kan-in no Miya Family in haste, (Prince Morohito of kan-in no Miya Family, he changed his name to Tomohito after the enthronement), who later succeeded to the throne as Emperor Kokaku.

Since his only child was Princess Yoshiko, the Imperial family adopted a child from the kan-in no Miya Family in haste, (Prince Morohito of kan-in no Miya Family, he changed his name to Tomohito after the enthronement), who later succeeded to the throne as Emperor Kokaku.

Since his only child was Imperil Princess Yoshiko, the Imperial family adopted a child from the kan-in no Miya family in haste, (Imperial Prince Morohito of kan-in no Miya family, he changed his name to Tomohito after the enthronement), who later succeeded to the throne as Emperor Kokaku.
sen.cmt: 内親王の表記親王の表記

sen.j: 欣子内親王はのちに光格天皇と縁組。
sen.e: Princess Yoshiko married to Emperor Kokaku later on.
Later on, Princess Yoshiko married Emperor Kokaku.
Later on, Imperial Princess Yoshiko married Emperor Kokaku.
sen.cmt: 内親王の表記スペース削除

sen.j: 宝暦9年1月18日（1759年2月15日） 儲君となる
sen.e: He became Crown Prince on February 15th, 1759.
He became Crown Prince on February 15th, 1759.
He became Crown Prince on February 15, 1759.

sen.j: 宝暦9年5月15日（1759年6月9日） 親王宣下
sen.e: He received to title Prince by Imperial order on June 9th, 1759.
He received to title Prince by Imperial order on June 9th, 1759.
He received to title Prince by Imperial order on June 9, 1759.

sen.j: 明和5年2月19日（1768年4月6日） 立太子
sen.e: He officially became Crown Prince on April 6th, 1768.
He officially became Crown Prince on April 6th, 1768.
He officially became Crown Prince on April 6, 1768.

sen.j: 明和5年8月9日（1768年9月19日） 元服
sen.e: He had a coming-of-age ceremony on September 19th, 1768.
He had a coming-of-age ceremony on September 19th, 1768.
He had a coming-of-age ceremony on September 19, 1768.

sen.j: 明和7年4月28日（1770年5月23日） 践祚
sen.e: He succeeded to the throne on May 23rd, 1770.
He succeeded to the throne on May 23rd, 1770.
He succeeded to the throne on May 23, 1770.

sen.j: 明和8年11月9日（1771年12月14日） 大嘗祭
sen.e: The Great Thanksgiving Service (after the Enthronement of an Emperor) was held on December 14th, 1771.
The Great Thanksgiving Service (a ceremony held after the Enthronement of an Emperor) was held on December 14th, 1771.
The Great Thanksgiving Service (a ceremony held after the Enthronement of an Emperor) was held on December 14, 1771.

sen.j: 京都市東山区今熊野泉山町の月輪陵（つきのわのみささぎ）に葬られた。
sen.e: The Emperor was entombed in Tsuki no Wa no Misasagi at Senzan-cho Town, Imagumano, Higashiyama Ward, Kyoto City
